page.title: 03FARMING
page.content: The local farms produce arable crops,especially wheat and barley. An increasing amount of grass is grown. In 1976 a company called Agridry moved to the disused Worminghall airfield and set up a factory for drying grass and making it into pellets for animal feed. Approximately twenty people are employed. The national company, Dean's Egg Farms has two farms in this block. Coldstream and Joshua Farms are run as ring farms, with day old chicks being kept for eighteen weeks, until they are old enough to lay. Then they are sent to the laying farms, which in this case, are in the Standlake area. Eggs are supplied to the Sainsbury and Waitrose supermarkets. Local farmers collect the waste, free, for manure.
